intro: Ranunculus flabellatus proles mollis, commonly known as the soft-leaved buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers with numerous stamens. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, this species thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and finely divided leaves. Its flowers bloom in spring and are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies.
